class_notes: Topic: Numbers & Narratives-Our worlds are shaped in part by complex processes of calculation and quantification that utilize features of narrative to explain, interpret, and contextualize data. How do we make sense of information and statistics through storytelling? How do we measure narratives? This course will introduce students to the fundamentals of narrative theory and data analysis, and study the practical relationship between story, discourse, and data to understand how narratives and numbers complicate each other.
course_description: An introduction to the study of narrative, with an emphasis on narrative fiction and the critical vocabulary used to describe it. Readings will vary by semester, and may include examples from other disciplines.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 6370, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 1-2:15p, Instructor: T. Tennant, Status: Closed
